moves.1... e5: I often follow that same opening also
moves.2... b6: and I follow with a stupid (soon to be proven) move
moves.3... f6: just about the only good thing that the pawns can be used for, except for resurrecting captured pieces
moves.4... Nh6: also move my knight... could have chosen better moves, but felt the need to get the knight out of hiding
moves.5. Bc4: no idea why he moved his bishop there...
moves.6. d4: this move exposed my knight, though the g7 pawn is defending it
moves.6... Ba6: I insist on swapping bishops... a little fight that in the end I win... you'll see
moves.7... Nxa6: I win the 'quarrel...'. I often think whether or not I should get myself into that 'argument,' as bishops are worth more than knights, but how else do I get one of his good pieces near the beginning of the game?
moves.8... f5: completely hopeless, superfluous move... of course, made by me...
moves.9... Bb4: a good move I finally saw I could do...
moves.10. Bg5: a response full of intimidation... I would take the life of his bishop if his f3 knight wasn't in the way...
moves.10... Qc7: the only reasonable move to do, really...
moves.11. Qd3: another forceful move aimed at taking my knight obviously
moves.11... Bxc3+: a pathetic move, just to try and get him to move his queen...
moves.12... b5: in complete dismay, I decide to use a pawn, again, for defense...
moves.13... Nb4: I see a chance here, so move my knight, in it's valour, to change the game around...
moves.14. Qa3: not so good a move, but exactly fits in with my plan...
moves.14... Nxc2+: double trouble for mario... a win for me... haha!
moves.15. Kd2: his superiority doesn't look as though it will hold much longer, so....
moves.16. Rae1: After losing his Queen, he must start the game next to all over again...
moves.16... Qa5+: I decide to put him in Check...
moves.17... bxc4: may as well take one of his pawns...
moves.18... c3: but I decide to not move, so move to the other side of the board again...
moves.19. exd7+: Oohhh... excellent move by mariodag... I can't castle now...
moves.19... Kxd7: Ah well, not much I can do about it, so I take his pawn...
moves.20. Re7+: Oh no... it seems he's up to something...
moves.21... c2+: I decide to put him in Check... just to get him back...
moves.22. Kc1: the only move he can make...
moves.22... Rab8: I have to use that castle for something...
moves.23. Re1e6+: Once again, a marvellous check made by mario...
moves.23... Kd5: I have less places to move...
moves.24... Kc4: the only place I could really move...
moves.25. Rxa5: Wow.... it seems that mario's beginning to turn the game around....
moves.25... Kc3: one of the only places left to move to, but good move at that...
moves.26. Rxa3+: or so I thought.... what's happening?
moves.26... Kc4: There goes my game... turned around from my advantage to his advantage...
moves.27. Kxc2: Just knew he'd take that... one of my last hopes...
moves.27... Rb4: I have to do my best, so start off with getting my castle out...
moves.28... Kb5: This game looks a bit risky...
moves.29. Rc5+: Oh please... this shows there's no mercy in Chess, haha!
moves.29... Kb6: I have to watch where I'm moving...
moves.30... a5: I have to bring in my pawn to defend my castle...
moves.31. Re6: Ah oh... excellent move by mariodag...
moves.31... Rc8: I have defense though, using another castle...
moves.32. Ne5: Ah oh... I can see where this is leading to...
moves.32... Ng8: I have to use my knight for something...
moves.33. Be3: well, I wasn't really thinking that mariodag would move his bishop to e3...
moves.33... Nf6: To tell the truth, it helped me pick out where to move my knight...
moves.34... Ka6: the game is focusing around that side and section of the board...
moves.35... Kb7: one of the last places I can move...
moves.36. Kxb4: Ah well, my castle put up a good fight.. haha.
moves.36... Ng4: hhmmm... a nice selection of pieces to take, though it won't really change the game.. haha.
moves.37. Re7+: oh bother... my selection of places to move my King are becoming shorter...
moves.38. Nd6+: Ah oh... a mixture of good pieces like that means a lose for me, for sure...
moves.38... Kb6: I decide to play around a bit...
moves.39. d5+: Hhmmm... seems nothing wrong with that move, except that it put me in check...
moves.39... c5+: I decide to 'fight back' lightly with a check of my own...
moves.40. Bxc5+: another check... very well thought out move...
moves.40... Rxc5: but I do a stupid move to get rid of that annoying bishop...
moves.41. Rxc5: and mariodag takes my castle with no worry of getting taken...
moves.41... f4: I decide to move one of my last pawns to f4...
moves.42. Rb7+: so, now, where do I move? I can see it coming to an end..
moves.43. Ra5#: and there you have it... An excellent game, turned from my advantage to mario's advantage... please feel free to comment- :)

gameName: A game I lost against a mate from Greece. A perfect example of turning around a game.
